casebody.data:
Steve Duane MOXLEY, Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. WD 80716 Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District. ORDER FILED: March 27, 2018 Mark A. Grothoff, Assistant Public Defender, Columbia, MO, Attorney for Appellant. Joshua D. Hawley, Attorney General, and Evan J. Buchheim, Assistant Attorney General, Jefferson City, MO, Attorneys for Respondent. Before Division IV: Mark D. Pfeiffer, Presiding Judge, and Cynthia L. Martin and Edward R. Ardini, Jr., Judges

Order

Per Curiam:

Mr. Steve Moxley appeals from the Judgment of the Circuit Court of Boone County, Missouri, denying his Rule 29.15 amended motion for post-conviction relief after an evidentiary hearing. Mr. Moxley claims that his trial counsel was ineffective in the cross-examination of a state's witness. Because a published opinion would have no precedential value, a memorandum of law has been provided to the parties. The judgment is affirmed. Rule 84.16(b).
